Returns: the current filter query provider or null if it does not exist
getFilterQueryProvider().Description: Returns the query filter provider used for filtering. When the provider is null, no filtering occurs.

Returns: a Cursor representing the results of the new query
Parameters: CharSequence: the constraint with which the query must be filtered
runQueryOnBackgroundThread(java.lang.Cha.Description: Runs a query with the specified constraint. This query is requested by the filter attached to this adapter. The query is provided by a @B_android#widget#FilterQueryProvider_E@. If no provider is specified, the current cursor is not filtered and returned. After this method returns the resulting cursor is passed to @B_android#support#v4#widget#CursorAdapter#changeCursor_E@ and the previous cursor is closed. This method is always executed on a background thread, not on the application's main thread (or UI thread.) Contract: when constraint is null or empty, the original results, prior to any filtering, must be returned.

Parameters: Cursor: the cursor to convert to a CharSequence
convertToString(android.database.Cursor).Description: Converts the cursor into a CharSequence. Subclasses should override this method to convert their results. The default implementation returns an empty String for null values or the default String representation of the value.

onContentChanged().Description: Called when the @B_android#database#ContentObserver_E@ on the cursor receives a change notification. The default implementation provides the auto-requery logic, but may be overridden by sub classes.

Returns: Returns the previously set Cursor, or null if there was not one. If the given new Cursor is the same instance is the previously set Cursor, null is also returned.
Parameters: Cursor: The new cursor to be used.
swapCursor(android.database.Cursor).Description: Swap in a new Cursor, returning the old Cursor. Unlike @B_android#support#v4#widget#CursorAdapter#changeCursor_E@, the returned old Cursor is not closed.

Parameters: Cursor: The new cursor to be used
changeCursor(android.database.Cursor).Description: Change the underlying cursor to a new cursor. If there is an existing cursor it will be closed.

Returns: a filter used to constrain data
getFilter().Description: Returns a filter that can be used to constrain data with a filtering pattern. This method is usually implemented by @B_android#widget#Adapter_E@ classes.

Returns: True if the same id always refers to the same object.
hasStableIds().Description: Indicates whether the item ids are stable across changes to the underlying data.

ClassDesc: Static library support version of the framework's https:##developer#android#com@B_android#widget#CursorAdapter_E@. Used to write apps that run on platforms prior to Android 3.0. When running on Android 3.0 or above, this implementation is still used; it does not try to switch to the framework's implementation. See the framework SDK documentation for a class overview.
